paragraphs.text: ("AUDY & ANTONI") stands as an autonomous Indonesian Law Firm specializing in a myriad of commercial, business-related affairs, dispute resolution and litigation. Established with a commitment to legal excellence, strategic clarity, and uncompromising integrity, the Firm has positioned itself as a trusted legal partner for corporations, business leaders, and clients navigating legal issues and regulatory landscape.

Our practice is firmly rooted in the realities of modern commerce. We regularly advise on multifaceted transactions and contentious matters that demand not only technical legal mastery, but also a deep understanding of business dynamics, risk management, and cross-border considerations. Whether acting as strategic counsel in transactional settings or as steadfast advocates in litigation and arbitration, we approach every mandate with rigor, precision, and foresight.

The Firm's lawyers are seasoned practitioners with complementary areas of expertise, enabling us to provide integrated and end-to-end legal solutions. Our core practices encompass corporate and commercial law, as well as dispute resolution, including complex litigation and alternative dispute mechanisms. This multidisciplinary strength allows us to address clients' legal needs holistically, ensuring consistency of strategy across advisory and contentious matters.

Operating comfortably within both domestic and international contexts, our lawyers are accustomed to engaging with cross-border transactions, foreign counterparties, and multinational stakeholders. We combine a strong command of Indonesian law with a global outlook, enabling us to bridge legal, cultural, and commercial differences with confidence and effectiveness.

At AUDY & ANTONI, legal advice is rendered with a focus on responsiveness, practical utility, and alignment with the client's objectives. Each engagement is approached through a careful evaluation of the client's legal position and commercial environment, with advice formulated to be legally sound, commercially informed, and capable of practical execution.

Guided by professionalism, discretion, and a steadfast dedication to our clients' interests, we strive to build enduring relationships founded on trust and results. Our commitment is to serve as more than legal advisers, we aim to be strategic partners, standing alongside our clients as they confront challenges, seize opportunities, and advance their business objectives with confidence.

list.name: AUDY RAHMAT
list.title: Partner
bio: Audy Rahmat is a Lawyer with decades of experience in corporate advisory, dispute resolution, and litigation. He oversees the Firm's general corporate matters as well as its dispute resolution and litigation practice, with a focus on complex commercial disputes arising from high-value commercial agreements and business transactions.

He has acted at all levels of proceedings before Indonesian courts, including the District Courts for general civil and criminal matters, the Commercial Courts for bankruptcy, suspension of debt payment obligations (PKPU), and intellectual property disputes, as well as the Industrial Relations Courts for employment-related disputes. He also regularly advises and represents clients during criminal proceedings at the investigation stage before law enforcement authorities.

Audy represents Indonesian and international clients in a broad range of business-related contentious matters, including debt recovery, tort claims, insolvency and restructuring, maritime and shipping disputes, insurance matters, and other commercial litigation. In addition to court proceedings, he has experience acting for clients in domestic and international arbitration and alternative dispute resolution.

He has significant experience in insolvency matters, including serving as a court-appointed receiver in bankruptcy proceedings, reflecting his involvement in complex restructuring and insolvency cases.

Earlier in his career, Audy was involved in high-profile special criminal litigation matters, including cases relating to money laundering, corruption, and white-collar crime, during his tenure at a leading Indonesian litigation law firm.

With a practice focused on litigation and alternative dispute resolution, Audy brings extensive courtroom and advisory experience to the Firm and is recognised for his strategic and measured approach in representing clients across various industries, from national enterprises to multinational corporations.
membership: Receiver and Administrator (Asosiasi Kurator dan Pengurus Indonesia - AKPI)

list.name: ANDELTON ANTONI
list.title: Partner
bio: Andelton Antoni is an Indonesian lawyer and legal consultant with extensive experience in corporate advisory and litigation. He has practised at several leading law firms and has also served as in-house legal counsel within the mining and energy sector in Indonesia. His professional background combines transactional advisory, regulatory compliance, and dispute resolution, enabling him to advise clients on matters that involve complex commercial and operational considerations.

He regularly assists domestic and foreign companies in relation to investment activities, corporate structuring, commercial transactions, and dispute resolution before Indonesian courts and in international arbitration proceedings. His practice spans a range of industries, with particular exposure to the energy, mining, and infrastructure sectors.

Antoni has experience handling significant business-related criminal matters, including cases involving money laundering, corruption, and white-collar crime, gained during his tenure at a leading Indonesian litigation law firm. He advises and represents clients in criminal proceedings arising from corporate activities and regulatory compliance issues.

In his corporate and project-related work, Antoni has advised on public private partnership (PPP) projects, infrastructure procurement, employment and labour law matters, land acquisition and compensation for mining operations, and cooperation arrangements with government entities. His experience includes advising on regulatory compliance and contractual arrangements in projects involving state-owned enterprises and regional governments.

On the contentious side, Antoni has represented corporate clients in a broad range of litigation matters, including commercial disputes, industrial relations disputes, bankruptcy and suspension of debt payment obligations (PKPU), and tax disputes arising in the context of insolvency and restructuring proceedings.

With a practice encompassing both corporate advisory and litigation, Antoni brings a practical and commercially informed approach to legal problem-solving and is experienced in assisting clients across the full lifecycle of business operations and disputes.
education: Pelita Harapan University, Bachelor of Law (SH)

practices.subtitle: Comprehensive Legal Expertise
practices.headerText: We focus on the following practice areas:

sectors.label: Industries
sectors.title: Business Sectors
sectors.description: Our expertise spans across diverse industries, providing tailored legal solutions for each sector's unique challenges.

areas.name: Civil & Commercial Litigation
areas.description: The Firm represents corporate clients in civil and commercial litigation before Indonesian courts, within Indonesia's civil law system. The scope of work includes contractual disputes, shareholder and joint venture disputes, corporate governance claims, debt recovery, and other commercial claims arising from business transactions. The Firm advises clients from pre-litigation assessment through proceedings at the District Courts, High Courts, and the Supreme Court, including enforcement of judgments.

areas.name: Bankruptcy, Insolvency & Restructuring
areas.description: The Firm advises corporate debtors, creditors, and financial stakeholders in bankruptcy and insolvency proceedings under Indonesian insolvency law, including suspension of debt payment obligations (PKPU). Services include representation before the Commercial Court, restructuring advisory, creditor negotiations, and disputes arising from insolvency and restructuring processes.

areas.name: Employment & Industrial Relation
areas.description: The Firm advises corporate employers on employment and industrial relations matters under Indonesian labour law. Services include advisory on employment contracts, termination of employment, workforce restructuring, and regulatory compliance, as well as representation in employment disputes before the Industrial Relations Court and related appellate proceedings.

areas.name: Arbitration & Alternative Dispute Resolution
areas.description: The Firm represents corporate clients in domestic and international arbitration and alternative dispute resolution proceedings arising from commercial and investment disputes. The Firm regularly advises in arbitrations conducted under the rules of the Indonesian National Board of Arbitration (BANI) and international arbitration institutions, including the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC). Services include arbitration strategy, drafting and negotiation of arbitration agreements, representation in arbitral proceedings, interim measures, and assistance in enforcement or annulment of arbitral awards before Indonesian courts in accordance with Indonesian arbitration law.

areas.name: Antitrust & Competition
areas.description: The Firm advises corporate clients on competition law and antitrust matters under Indonesian competition regulations. Services include compliance advisory, merger notification and assessment, representation in investigations and proceedings before the Indonesian Competition Commission (KPPU), and litigation relating to competition law decisions.

areas.name: Criminal Litigation
areas.description: The Firm represents corporate clients, directors, and officers in business-related criminal matters under Indonesian law, including cases involving fraud, embezzlement, breach of trust, corporate misconduct, and corruption-related offences. The Firm advises and represents clients in proceedings handled by law enforcement authorities, including the Corruption Eradication Commission (Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi – KPK), the police, and public prosecutors. Services include legal assistance at the investigation, prosecution, and trial stages, as well as strategic advisory in relation to criminal risk management, asset seizure, and coordination with parallel civil, administrative, or regulatory proceedings and assistance in matters involving corporate liability and the potential exposure of directors and officers under Indonesian criminal law.

areas.name: State Administrative Disputes
areas.description: The Firm represents corporate clients in state administrative disputes arising from business activities and regulatory actions by government authorities. Services include challenging or defending administrative decisions, permits, and sanctions before the State Administrative Courts (Pengadilan Tata Usaha Negara), as well as appellate proceedings.

areas.name: Tax
areas.description: The Firm advises corporate taxpayers on tax disputes and litigation under Indonesian tax law. Services include representation in tax audits, objections, appeals, and proceedings before the Tax Court, as well as advisory on tax dispute management and resolution strategies.

areas.name: Judicial Review
areas.description: The Firm advises corporate & private clients on judicial review proceedings relating to laws, regulations, and administrative measures affecting business activities or constitutional rights. Services include legal analysis, preparation of submissions, and representation in judicial review proceedings before the Supreme Court and other competent judicial authorities.

areas.name: Merger & Acquisition
areas.description: The Firm advises on mergers, acquisitions, divestments, joint ventures, and corporate reorganisations involving private and public companies. The scope of work includes legal due diligence, transaction structuring, negotiation and drafting of share purchase agreements, asset transfer agreements, shareholders' agreements, and related transaction documents, as well as assistance with regulatory approvals and post-completion matters.

areas.name: Investment
areas.description: The Firm provides legal advice on domestic and foreign investment in Indonesia, including market entry, establishment of investment structures, compliance with investment regulations, and ongoing corporate governance matters. The Firm assists investors in structuring investments, negotiating investment and shareholders' arrangements, and liaising with relevant regulatory authorities.

areas.name: Corporate and Commercial
areas.description: The Firm advises on a broad range of corporate and commercial matters, including company formation, corporate governance, regulatory compliance, and general corporate advisory. Services include drafting, reviewing, and negotiating commercial agreements, as well as advising on contractual risk management and business operations.

areas.name: Project, Infrastructure & Construction
areas.description: The Firm advises sponsors, developers, contractors, and other stakeholders on projects and infrastructure developments, including public private partnership (PPP) projects involving government and state-owned entities. Advisory services include project and PPP structuring, procurement and tender processes, drafting and negotiation of project, construction, and engineering contracts (including EPC and related agreements), compliance with sector-specific and public procurement regulations, and dispute-related advisory arising from project development and execution.

areas.name: Banking & Finance
areas.description: The Firm acts for lenders, borrowers, and financial institutions in banking and finance transactions. The scope of work includes advising on loan and financing structures, security and collateral arrangements, financing documentation, regulatory compliance, and restructuring of existing financing arrangements, including transactions with cross-border elements.

areas.name: Capital Markets
areas.description: The Firm advises issuers, underwriters, and other market participants on capital markets transactions. Services include equity and debt offerings, public offerings and private placements, compliance with securities laws and regulations, ongoing disclosure obligations, and regulatory matters involving capital market authorities.

areas.name: Intellectual Property
areas.description: The Firm advises on the protection, registration, management, and enforcement of intellectual property rights. Services cover trademarks, copyrights, patents, licensing and technology transfer arrangements, as well as advisory and dispute-related matters concerning intellectual property assets.
